conclusion: Understanding forces acting on the small ball and changes when voltage is applied.
Small ball falls vertically between two uncharged parallel metal plates.
Ball has a weight of G and distance between plates is d.
Initial direction of force on ball is along line AB.
Force due to gravity is mg.
Force due to electric field between plates is qV.
Direction of force on ball changes to direction along line BC.
Force due to gravity remains mg.
Force due to electric field between plates changes to qV'.
Net force on ball must be zero for equilibrium.
Net force is sum of forces due to gravity and electric field.
Rearranging equation gives qV = qV' - mg.
Dividing both sides by q gives V = V' - mg/q.
Charge amount of small ball is q = mg/V' - mg/q.
Final answer: charge amount of small ball is mg/V' - mg/q.
